results.content: This is an explanation of a boileplate project. It's all reviews from the files, not real teaching at all.

response.content:
Hi, Paul!
Thanks for review.
The description of course contains:
"You get the finished application and concentrate on the processes. The lecturer explains what the thing is and how it works.".

I passed many courses. It's great when you can learn new approaches as soon as possible (from my point of view). That's why I choose this strategy to teach.

Feel free to return money via Udemy.

Thanks.

results.content: suggestions: thick accent was challenging to understand.   Biggest problem was complete lack of tests.   In my opinion this is teaching extremely bad habits that have no place in modern software development.  every component and every page should be introduced with its tests, and it should be explained how specific changes were made in order to maximize the component's testability. If I had time I would love to contribute tests but the author should get this process started and set the tone and ask others to contribute.

response.content:
Craeg, thanks for the feedback on your experience with the course. I sincerely appreciate your insight.
A variety of tests will be introduced soon. I have started. ;-)
I will text you as soon as I do it.
[Updated]
I just sent you a message and added a section to the course (work continues). Thank you! ;-)

results.content_html: suggestions: thick accent was challenging to understand. Biggest problem was complete lack of tests. In my opinion this is teaching extremely bad habits that have no place in modern software development. every component and every page should be introduced with its tests, and it should be explained how specific changes were made in order to maximize the component's testability. If I had time I would love to contribute tests but the author should get this process started and set the tone and ask others to contribute.

results.content: An excellent course, both for a beginning programmer, and for someone who's already worked with frontend ReactJS and backend PostgreSQL. Efficient course material delivery. All steps are well explained. I strongly recommend this course.

I'm working on getting better.
